title: Revert Mordekaiser's changes and let Colt "Ezreal" Hallam do it
body: He's the guy who reworked Sion. I'm sure he can make Mordekaiser amazing while still keeping his distinguishable character unique.

You really are defending him...

Alright, I HAVE played him, I abused him twice to get gold in season 4 and then this season because there are no drawbacks whatsoever to picking him.

He has EVERYTHING in his kit. He is the PERFECT support.  "Oh but he doesn't have sustain!" Buy Relic.  Problem solved. He now possesses an immobilizing lockdown with a lowered cooldown on champion contact, a get out of jail free card for your allies on a low cooldown that also shields, an AoE displacement knockup that also slows AND gives a bonus attack ratio, an AoE borderline stun on contact for zone control and lockdown, in addition to having free armor and AP from collected souls.

That leaves sustain as the ONLY thing he doesn't have...and you can buy Relic. He fits into every team comp, can be picked into any enemy team, and will always be relevant no matter how many nerfs he receives because his kit is fundamentally broken with the inclusion of so much unnecessary shit tacked onto it for no reason.

You don't seem to understand the concept of "someone will always be stronger". Thresh is a strong support, yes. Probably the strongest in the game. But he isn't overpowered. He is only the strongest by a small margin (I do believe Braum and Alistar are right next to him in terms of power). I made a comment on Thresh on the boards a month ago in terms of his power compared to every other support, and it went like this:

"Thresh is the Jack-of-all-Trades support. He does a bit of everything and does it all well, but he doesn't have anything that he himself does better than any other support other than his lantern. 

Displacement? {{champion:12}} {{champion:53}} {{champion:111}}   are better at that. Lock down? {{champion:12}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:89}} {{champion:111}} {{champion:223}}     are better at that. He has no sustain without {{item:3302}} , and even then it isn't nearly as good as {{champion:432}} {{champion:267}} {{champion:37}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:44}}. Shield? {{champion:43}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:117}}    all have better shields. Peel? {{champion:12}} {{champion:432}} {{champion:201}} {{champion:40}} {{champion:117}}    can all peel better than Thresh can. And the list goes on. He is strong, yes, but he does not need nerfs. The last couple to his lantern and to his ult were enough to put him in a solid spot.

Also, to point out, if you nerf Thresh to a point where he isn't that strong anymore, another support will take his spot and be "the strongest", and then people will cry for nerfs for them, and the cycle will continue. Supports are in a great spot now, no need for changes at this time."

Thresh isn't overloaded. He is really really balanced. The only thing that I would ever change, if anything at all because he is really solid right now, would be the passive damage on Flay. I would reduce it a little bit, because it gives him a lot of lane power. However, even I wouldn't change that since it is almost meaningless late game. And that's another thing. Thresh's late game is kinda poor compared to his lanning phase. He is like {{champion:53}} in that his design is to win the lane and showball the team by roaring out of the bot lane. Early-mid game, a hook means death. Late game, a hook means almost nothing if the other team is positioned correctly (if they are positioned poorly, that's on them, not on Thresh being "OP") because you will hit the tanks, and going in on the tanks is stupid unless you can turn that into killing the carries, which is difficult in its own right.

I'm getting tired of people senselessly complaining about meaningless things on the boards. And you, Keevalroy, have a history of complaining. I have to assume that you only complain instead of changing strategies in-game and working around difficult decisions, because the people that do aren't complaining on the boards, and they have nothing to complain about.

Thresh annoys the shit out of me, but I agree with you. That was really well said, people are always gonna be bitching about something, and it mostly starts because people don't know how to play against a champion or get annoyed by them so they start complaining about it and it's so dumb

People need to understand that "annoying" and "overpowered" aren't the same thing
They could nerf the damage on his e, but lets just all be honest and say that AD thresh is fun as hell (if unviable).

The problem isn't that Thresh is easymode or too powerful, it's that he's just too good at too much shit, everything that a support can do, he can do too, and sometimes he can do better, with the exception of healing. He's choking pick diversity just because there's never a situation in which he's not an optimal pick.

Disengage comp: janna.
Soraka is a good generic pick too...
Protect ADC comp, braum, janna, morgana, etc. 
knock up comp: malphite, naut, etc.
I'd say maybe leona is slightly UP, but there is pick diversity with supports (nami needs a buff tho).

He's really healthy, and the ideas were great, but it came out as a really bad champ. Morde's rework had both shtty ideas and bad execution. And by bad execution, I mean making the numbers too damn high, and the idea of multiplative damage and melee ADC bot lane is shtty.

CertainlyT does have his good share of ideas and designs. Although kalista, yas, and dar are all broken champs, they are still fun to play, and yas and kalista are really popular champs, which are unique champs in LoL.
Sion wasn't a bad champ when he came out.  Riot went overboard on nerfs in early-mid Season 5 because of Cinderhulk and the Tank Meta.

His E is not interruptable. It's pretty reliable and impactful.

If your Q is interrupted, it goes on a lowered cooldown. If the enemy is blowing CC on the tank, you're doing it right.
